title: The One Where Nana Dies Twice

scenes.scene_description: Scene: Chandler's Office, Chandler is on a coffee break. Shelley enters.

dialogue.speaker: SHELLY
dialogue.text: Hey gorgeous, how's it going?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Dehydrated Japanese noodles under fluorescent lights... does it get better than this?

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Question. You're not dating anybody, are you, because I met somebody who would be perfect for you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah, y'see, perfect might be a problem. Had you said 'co-dependent', or 'self-destructive'...

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Do you want a date Saturday?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes please.

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Okay. He's cute, he's funny, he's-

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: He's a he?

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Well yeah! ...Oh God. I- just- I thought- Good, Shelley. I'm just gonna go flush myself down the toilet now...(backs out of the room) Okay, goodbye...

scenes.event_description: Scene: Chandler's Office, Chandler is on a coffee break. Shelley enters.

events.event_description: Shelly enters Chandler's office and greets him.
Chandler responds to Shelley's greeting with a sarcastic remark about his current state.
Shelley asks Chandler if he is dating anyone.
Chandler comments that being perfect might be problematic and makes a joke about co-dependency and self-destruction.
Shelley asks Chandler if he wants to go on a date on Saturday.
Chandler agrees to go on the date.
Shelley describes the person she has in mind as cute and funny.
Shelley clarifies that the person she is interested in is male.
Shelley realizes her mistake and expresses embarrassment, then backs out of the room.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...Couldn't enjoy a cup of noodles after that. I mean, is that ridiculous? Can you believe she actually thought that?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um... yeah. Well, I mean, when I first met you, y'know, I thought maybe, possibly, you might be...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You did?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, but then you spent Phoebe's entire birthday party talking to my breasts, so then I figured maybe not.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Huh. Did, uh... any of the rest of you guys think that when you first met me?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I did.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think so, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Not me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nono, me neither. Although, uh, y'know, back in college, Susan Sallidor did.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're kidding! Did you tell her I wasn't?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No. No, it's just 'cause, uh, I kinda wanted to go out with her too, so I told her, actually, you were seeing Bernie Spellman... who also liked her, so...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, this is fascinating. So, uh, what is it about me?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I dunno, 'cause you're smart, you're funny...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ross is smart and funny, d'you ever think that about him?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah! Right!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: WHAT IS IT?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, I-I d'know, you-you just- you have a quality.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yes. Absolutely. A quality.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, a quality, good, because I was worried you guys were gonna be vague about this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hello? Hello? Oh! Rachel, it's Paolo calling from Rome.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Calling from Rome! (Takes phone) Bon giorno, caro mio.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Joey) So he's calling from Rome. I could do that. Just gotta go to Rome.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, your dad just beeped in, but can you make it quick? Talking to Rome. (Showing off to Phoebe and Chandler) I'm talking to Rome.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey dad, what's up? (Listens) Oh God. Ross, it's Nana.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there.)

events.event_description: Chandler expresses disbelief about not enjoying a cup of noodles after a certain incident.
Rachel admits she initially thought Chandler might be someone special when she first met him.
Rachel explains she changed her opinion of Chandler after he spent Phoebe's birthday party talking to her breasts.
Chandler asks if others also had initial impressions of him, and Monica and Phoebe confirm they did.
Ross denies having an initial impression of Chandler, mentioning a college crush on Susan Sallidor.
Ross reveals he told Susan Sallidor that Chandler was seeing Bernie Spellman to hide his own feelings.
Chandler questions what it is about him that causes others to have initial impressions, and Monica suggests he has a certain quality.
The group collectively agrees that Chandler has a certain 'quality' that influences their perceptions.
Monica receives a phone call from her dad, indicating someone is calling from Rome.
Rachel answers her phone and speaks in Italian, indicating she is talking to someone in Rome.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, Mr. and Mrs. Geller are there, along with Aunt Lillian. Ross and
Monica enter and everyone says hi and kisses.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So, uh, how's she doing?

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: The doctor says it's a matter of hours.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How-how are you, Mom?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Me? I'm fine, fine. I'm glad you're here. ...What's with your hair?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: What's different?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Oh, maybe that's it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: She is unbelievable, our mother is...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, relax, relax. We are gonna be here for a while, it looks like, and we still have boyfriends and your career to cover.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh God!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: The fuzzy little mints at the bottom of her purse.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh! ...Yeah, they were gross. Oh, you know what I loved? Her Sweet 'n' Los. How she was always stealing them from- from restaurants.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Not just restaurants, from our house.

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: Mrs. Geller?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She looks so small.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, at least she's with Pop-Pop and Aunt Phyllis now.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: G'bye, Nana. (She kisses her on the forehead.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Bye, Nana.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: What is going on?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'know how-how the nurse said that-that Nana had passed? Well, she's not, quite..

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She's not- past, she's present, she's back.

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: (reentering) What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: She may have died.

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: She may have died?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: We're looking into it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I, uh, I'll go see. (He goes in)

dialogue.speaker: NURSE
dialogue.text: This almost never happens!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Now she's passed.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Hospital, Mr. and Mrs. Geller are there, along with Aunt Lillian. Ross and
Monica enter and everyone says hi and kisses.)

events.event_description: Ross asks Aunt Lillian about the condition of the patient in the hospital.
Aunt Lillian informs Ross that the doctor says the patient has only hours to live.
Monica greets her mother and asks how she is doing.
Mrs. Geller responds that she is fine and comments on Monica's hair.
Mrs. Geller questions Monica about her appearance, implying she notices a change.
Ross comments on the patient's small size and mentions her being with her grandparents.
Monica kisses her grandmother on the forehead and says goodbye.
Ross announces that the patient has passed away.
The nurse comments that such an event almost never happens.
Ross states that the patient is now deceased.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Phoebe, Joey, and Rachel are there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I just have to know, okay. Is it my hair?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (exasperated) Yes, Chandler, that's exactly what it is. It's your hair.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, you have homosexual hair.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, um, did she...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Twice.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Twice?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, that sucks!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You guys okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I dunno, it's weird. I mean, I know she's gone, but I just don't feel, uh...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Maybe that's 'cause she's not really gone.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nono, she's gone.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We checked. A lot.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hm, I mean maybe no-one ever really goes. Ever since my mom died, every now and then, I get the feeling that she's like right here, y'know? (She circles her hand around her right shoulder. Chandler, sitting on her right, draws back nervously) Oh! And Debbie, my best friend from junior high- got struck by lightning on a miniature golf course- I always get this really strong Debbie vibe whenever I use one of those little yellow pencils, y'know? ...I miss her.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Aw. Hey, Pheebs, want this? (Gives her a pencil)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thanks!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sure. I just sharpened her this morning.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Now, see, I don't believe any of that. I think once you're dead, you're dead! You're gone! You're worm food! (realises his tactlessness) ...So Chandler looks gay, huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know, I dunno who this is, but it's not Debbie. (Hands back the pencil)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Phoebe, Joey, and Rachel are there.]

events.event_description: Chandler asks if his hair is the reason for Rachel and Phoebe's reactions.
Rachel confirms to Chandler that his hair is the reason for their reactions.
Phoebe comments that Chandler has homosexual hair.
Rachel mentions that someone was twice, implying a second encounter.
Ross expresses confusion about the situation, feeling it's weird that his ex is gone but he doesn't feel it.
Phoebe suggests that no one ever really goes, sharing her feelings about her mother's death and her friend Debbie.
Rachel offers Phoebe a sharpened yellow pencil, which Phoebe accepts.
Joey states his belief that once you're dead, you're gone and worm food, showing his disbelief in the idea of spirits or the afterlife.
Joey comments on Chandler's hair, asking if it looks gay, after realizing his tactless remark.
Phoebe clarifies that the pencil she has is not Debbie, indicating she is dismissing Joey's assumption.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Nana's house, Ross, Mrs. Geller and Aunt Lillian are going through clothes.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I thought it was gonna be a closed casket.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Well, that doesn't mean she can't look nice!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Sweetie, you think you can get in there?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) I don't see why not.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Here's my retainer!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Nana's house, Ross, Mrs. Geller and Aunt Lillian are going through clothes.]

events.event_description: Ross comments on the funeral, saying he thought it was going to be a closed casket.
Mrs. Geller responds that the deceased can still look nice despite the open casket.
Mrs. Geller asks Ross if he thinks he can get into the casket.
Ross sarcastically replies that he doesn't see why he can't get in, implying he might try to do so.
Ross offers his retainer, suggesting he is prepared or joking about attempting to get into the casket.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is talking to her father.]

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: I was just thinking. When my time comes-

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Dad!

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Listen to me! When my time comes, I wanna be buried at sea.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You what?

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: I wanna be buried at sea, it looks like fun.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Define fun.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: C'mon, you'll make a day of it! You'll rent a boat, pack a lunch...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...And then we throw your body in the water... Gee, that does sound fun.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Everyone thinks they know me. Everyone says 'Jack Geller, so predictable'. Maybe after I'm gone, they'll say 'Buried at sea! Huh!'.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's probably what they'll say.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: I'd like that.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is talking to her father.]

events.event_description: Mr. Geller begins expressing his wish to be buried at sea.
Monica reacts with surprise to her father's statement about being buried at sea.
Mr. Geller explains his desire to be buried at sea because it looks like fun.
Monica questions the definition of fun in relation to her father's burial wish.
Mr. Geller suggests that a burial at sea would involve renting a boat and packing a lunch.
Monica sarcastically comments that throwing her father's body into the water sounds fun.
Mr. Geller envisions that after his death, people will think of him as 'Buried at sea!'
Monica agrees with her father's humorous prediction about what people will say after his death.
Mr. Geller expresses his desire to be remembered as 'Buried at sea!'
The scene concludes with Mr. Geller expressing his satisfaction with his plan to be buried at sea.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler's Office, Shelley is drinking coffee; Chandler enters.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, gorgeous.

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: (sheepish) Hey. Look, I'm sorry about yesterday, I, um-

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, nono, don't- don't worry about it. Believe me, apparently other people have made the same mistake.

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Oh! Okay! Phew!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, uh... what do you think it is about me?

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: I dunno, uh... you just have a-a...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...Quality, right, great.

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Y'know, it's a shame, because you and Lowell would've made a great couple.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Lowell? Financial Services' Lowell, that's who you saw me with?

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: What? He's cute!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, yeah... 's'no Brian in Payroll.

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Is Brian...?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No! Uh, I d'know! The point is, if you were gonna set me up with someone, I'd like to think you'd set me up with someone like him.

dialogue.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogue.text: Well, I think Brian's a little out of your league.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Excuse me? You don't think I could get a Brian? Because I could get a Brian. Believe you me. ...I'm really not.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler's Office, Shelley is drinking coffee; Chandler enters.]

events.event_description: Chandler enters his office and greets Shelley with 'Hey, gorgeous.'
Shelley sheepishly apologizes to Chandler about an incident from the previous day.
Chandler reassures Shelley that her mistake is not a big deal and mentions others have made similar mistakes.
Shelley expresses relief after Chandler's reassurance.
Chandler asks Shelley what she thinks about him.
Shelley comments that Chandler has a certain quality that makes him attractive.
Shelley mentions that she thinks Chandler and Lowell would have been a good couple.
Chandler questions Shelley about Lowell, implying he is someone she saw him with at work.
Shelley clarifies that Lowell is someone from Financial Services and comments on his attractiveness.
Chandler reacts surprised and clarifies that he was seen with Brian in Payroll, denying being with Lowell.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Nana's Bedroom, Ross is holding a dress out from inside the closet.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (holding a dress out from inside the closet) This one?

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I have shown you everything we have. Unless you want your mother to spend eternity in a lemon yellow pant-suit, go with the burgundy.

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: You know, whatever we pick, she would've told us it's the wrong one.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: You're right. We'll go with the burgundy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh! A fine choice. I'm coming out. (Starts to climb over the furniture)

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: Wait! We need shoes!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. Um, how about these? (Holds out a pair)

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: That's really a day shoe.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And where she's going everyone else'll be dressier?

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: Could we see something in a slimmer heel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (forages around) Okay, I have nothing in an evening shoe in the burgundy. I can show you something in a silver that may work.

dialogue.speaker: AUNT LILLIAN
dialogue.text: No, it really should be burgundy.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Mm. Unless we go with a different dress?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No! Nonono, wait a sec. I may have something in the back.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God..

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Is everything all right, dear?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, just... just Nana stuff.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Nana's Bedroom, Ross is holding a dress out from inside the closet.]

events.event_description: Ross holds a dress out from inside the closet and asks if it is the right one.
Aunt Lillian responds that the dress is not the right one.
Ross suggests choosing the burgundy dress to Aunt Lillian.
Aunt Lillian comments that whatever dress they pick, Nana would say it's wrong.
Mrs. Geller agrees to go with the burgundy dress.
Ross announces he is coming out and begins to climb over the furniture.
Aunt Lillian reminds Ross that they need to see shoes.
Ross offers a pair of shoes to Aunt Lillian.
Mrs. Geller comments that the shoes Ross shows are more suitable for daytime.
Ross searches for evening shoes in burgundy and considers silver shoes as alternatives.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are preparing to leave for the funeral.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) How we doing, you guys ready?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Mom already called this morning to remind me not to wear my hair up. Did you know my ears are not my best feature?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Some days it's all I can think about.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi, sorry I'm late, I couldn't find my bearings.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, you-you mean your earrings?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What'd I say?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sticking her foot out) Hm-m.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are these the shoes?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes. Paolo sent them from Italy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, we-uh- we don't have shoes here, or...?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering with Chandler) Morning. We ready to go?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, don't we look nice all dressed up?...It's stuff like that, isn't it?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are preparing to leave for the funeral.]

events.event_description: Ross enters the scene and asks if everyone is ready to leave.
Monica mentions her mother called to remind her not to wear her hair up and comments on her ears.
Ross responds that some days he can't stop thinking about his ears.
Phoebe enters the scene apologizing for being late and explains she couldn't find her bearings.
Rachel comments on Phoebe's earrings, implying Phoebe was referring to her earrings when she said she couldn't find her bearings.
Phoebe asks what she said, showing confusion about her statement.
Rachel sticks her foot out to indicate Phoebe's shoes, asking if they are the shoes.
Rachel confirms that the shoes are sent from Italy by Paolo.
Ross questions whether they have shoes here or not.
Joey and Chandler enter the scene, with Joey asking if they are ready to go and Chandler commenting on their appearance.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It was a really beautiful service.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: It really was. Oh, c'mere, sweetheart. (Hugs her) Y'know, I think it might be time for you to start using night cream.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nothing, just your overcoat sounds remarkably like Brent Mussberger.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Check it out, Giants-Cowboys. (He has a pocket TV)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're watching a football game at a funeral?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, it's the pre-game. I'm gonna watch it at the reception.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You are a frightening, frightening man.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh no! My new Paolo shoes!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I hope they're not ruined.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: God, what a great day. ...What? Weather-wise!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know, uh, the air, the-the trees... even though Nana's gone there's, there's something almost, uh- I dunno, almost life-aff- (Not looking where he is going he falls into an open grave)

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: God! Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm fine. Just-just... having my worst fear realised...

events.event_description: Monica comments that the funeral service was beautiful.
Mrs. Geller hugs Monica and suggests she start using night cream.
Joey remarks 'What?' in response to Mrs. Geller's comment.
Chandler comments that Joey's overcoat sounds like Brent Mussberger.
Joey shows a pocket TV and mentions watching a football game at the reception.
Chandler questions Joey about watching a football game at a funeral.
Joey affirms he is watching the pre-game of a football game.
Chandler comments that Joey is a frightening man for watching football at a funeral.
Rachel exclaims that her new Paolo shoes are ruined.
Ross expresses hope that Rachel's shoes are not ruined, then falls into an open grave.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Wake, at the Gellers' house. Ross is lying on his back, with Phoebe
squatting over him, checking to see if he's injured.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, don't worry, I'm just checking to see if the muscle's in spasm...huh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What, what is it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You missed a belt loop.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh! No-n-

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, it's in spasm.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Here, sweetie, here. I took these when I had my golfing accident. (Hands Ross a bottle of pills. Then turns to Monica and pats her hair over her ears)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, no-

dialogue.speaker: ANDREA
dialogue.text: Sorry- Hi, I'm Dorothy's daughter.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi, I'm Chandler, and I have no idea who Dorothy is.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, look who's up! How do you feel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I feel great. I feel- great, I fleel great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow, those pills really worked, huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Not the first two, but the second two- woooo! ...I love you guys. You guys are the greatest. I love my sister (Kisses Monica), I love Pheebs... (Hugs her)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh! That's so nice...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...Chandler!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (hugs him) And listen, man, if you wanna be gay, be gay. Doesn't matter to me.

dialogue.speaker: ANDREA
dialogue.text: (turns to a friend) You were right. (They walk off and leave Chandler.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rachel. Rachel Rachel. (Sits down beside her) I love you the most.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (humouring him) Oh, well you know who I love the most?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh.. you don't get it! (Passes out and slumps across her)

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Whaddya got there?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (hides the TV, but he still has an earphone) Just a, uh... hearing disability.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: What's the score?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Seventeen-fourteen Giants... three minutes to go in the third.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Beautiful! (Turns to watch with him)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (still trapped under Ross) Pheebs, could you maybe hand me a cracker?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Your grandmother would have hated this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, sure, what with it being her funeral and all.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: No, I'd be hearing about 'Why didn't I get the honey-glazed ham?', I didn't spend enough on flowers, and if I spent more she'd be saying 'Why are you wasting your money? I don't need flowers, I'm dead'.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That sounds like Nana.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Do you know what it's like to grow up with someone who is critical of every single thing you say?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...I can imagine.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, it's a wonder your mother turned out to be the positive, life-affirming person that she is.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That is a wonder. So tell me something, Mom. If you had to do it all over again, I mean, if she was here right now, would you tell her?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Tell her what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How she drove you crazy, picking on every little detail, like your hair... for example.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: I'm not sure I know what you're getting at.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you think things would have been better if you'd just told her the truth?

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: ...No. I think some things are better left unsaid. I think it's nicer when people just get along.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Huh.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: More wine, dear?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I think so.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: (reaches out to fiddle with Monica's hair again, and realises) Those earrings look really lovely on you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thank you. They're yours.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GELLER
dialogue.text: Actually they were Nana's.

dialogue.speaker: MR. GELLER
dialogue.text: Now I'm depressed! ...(To everyone) Even more than I was.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Wake, at the Gellers' house. Ross is lying on his back, with Phoebe
squatting over him, checking to see if he's injured.]

events.event_description: Phoebe checks Ross for injuries by examining his muscles and belt loop.
Mrs. Geller offers Ross a bottle of pills from her golfing accident.
Ross expresses feeling great and kisses his sister Monica and hugs Phoebe.
Ross declares his love for his friends and makes a joke about Chandler's sexuality.
Ross passes out and slumps across Rachel, expressing his love for her.
Joey hides the TV with an earphone, claiming he has a hearing disability, while discussing the football score with Mr. Geller.
Rachel asks Phoebe to hand her a cracker while she is trapped under Ross.
Mrs. Geller comments that her mother would have hated the scene at the funeral.
Mrs. Geller discusses her critical mother and reflects on whether things would have been better if she had told her the truth.
Mrs. Geller gives Monica her earrings, revealing they belonged to Nana, and comments on her own feelings about the funeral.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang are looking at old photos.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, who's this little naked guy?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That little naked guy would be me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Aww, look at the little thing.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, fine, that is my penis. Can we be grown-ups now?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Who are those people?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Got me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that's Nana, right there in the middle. (Reads the back) 'Me and the gang at Java Joe's'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow, Monica, you look just like your grandmother. How old was she there?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let's see, 1939... yeah, 24, 25?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Looks like a fun gang. (They all look at each other and smile)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ooh, look-look-look-look-look! I got Monica naked!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (looking) Nono, that would be me again. I'm, uh, just trying something.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the gang are looking at old photos.]

events.event_description: Rachel points at a photo and asks who the little naked guy is.
Ross responds that the little naked guy is himself.
Rachel comments affectionately about the naked photo.
Ross clarifies that the photo shows his penis and asks if they can be grown-ups.
Chandler asks who the people in the photo are.
Ross admits he does not know who the people in the photo are.
Monica identifies Nana in the photo and reads the back of it.
Rachel comments that Monica looks like her grandmother and asks about her age in the photo.
Monica estimates her grandmother's age in the photo as 24 or 25.
Joey excitedly points out that he has a photo of Monica naked, and Ross clarifies that the photo is of himself.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler's Office, Chandler is on a coffee break as Lowell enters.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, Lowell.

dialogue.speaker: LOWELL
dialogue.text: Hey, Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So how's it going there in Financial Services?

dialogue.speaker: LOWELL
dialogue.text: It's like Mardi Gras without the paper mache heads. How 'bout you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Good, good. Listen, heh, I dunno what Shelley told you about me, but, uh... I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: LOWELL
dialogue.text: I know. That's what I told her.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Really.

dialogue.speaker: LOWELL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So- you can tell?

dialogue.speaker: LOWELL
dialogue.text: Pretty much, most of the time. We have a kind of... radar.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So you don't think I have a, a quality?

dialogue.speaker: LOWELL
dialogue.text: Speaking for my people, I'd have to say no. By the way, your friend Brian from Payroll, he is.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: He is ?

dialogue.speaker: LOWELL
dialogue.text: Yup, and waaay out of your league. (Exits)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Out of my league. I could get a Brian. (Brian enters behind him) If I wanted to get a Brian, I could get a Brian. (Sees him) Hey, Brian.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler's Office, Chandler is on a coffee break as Lowell enters.]

events.event_description: Chandler greets Lowell upon his entrance to the office.
Lowell responds to Chandler's greeting and inquires about his work in Financial Services.
Lowell compares his department to Mardi Gras without paper mache heads and asks Chandler about his situation.
Chandler responds positively and mentions he is unsure about what Shelley told Lowell about him.
Lowell confirms he knows about Chandler's reputation and states he told Shelley so.
Chandler expresses surprise and curiosity about Lowell's statement.
Lowell indicates that he and his colleagues have a 'radar' to sense Chandler's qualities.
Lowell states that Chandler's friend Brian from Payroll is out of Chandler's league.
Lowell exits the scene, leaving Chandler alone.
Chandler comments on the idea of getting a Brian and then notices Brian entering the office.
